text:
I bought a Dreamcast just over a month ago (I had wanted one since I was a teenager) and my girlfriend asked me why I bought such an old console.
I popped in this game, and she couldn't get over how good the graphics looked on a game this old.

She's not wrong you know...

author: sonicfreak94

text: @sonicfreak94 humm thanks but where i cand find the game file to use in the emulator?
author: Luzitanium

text:
@Lusitanus
"NullDC" is a good emulator to use for emulating the Dreamcast. There are some other alternatives such as "Demul," but NullDC seems a bit more polished to me. As for the PS2, the only PS2 emulator I know of is "PCSX2." If you like, I can PM you some links and resources to get you started, or you can look them up on Google.
author: sonicfreak94

text:
@sonicfreak94 forgot to ask, where and how can i emulate dreamcast or ps 2 ??
I already emulated games from mega drive and nintendo 64
author: Luzitanium

text: @sonicfreak94 here in my country its illegal only if you download to make money from it. now if you download for use at home its fine, because its like someone lending it to you.
author: Luzitanium

text:
@Lusitanus 
If you have a computer powerful enough to emulate the Sega Dreamcast or the Playstation 2, then yes. If you don't own the console or game you're trying to emulate however, it's illegal, from my understanding. (In the United States at least; I'm not sure how it is in other countries.)

author: Onyx Wolf

text:
@Morax666666 - If you liked the old Ecco games, you will LOVE Defender of the Future in my opinion. It's basically the same idea as the old Eccos except it's in 3D. That's the best I can describe it.

In the same vein as the older Eccos, too, it's VERY hard to beat - some levels took me several hours to days to eventually figure out. Excellent game though - a game ANY Ecco fan simply has to play :)
